story:
Ուշծեր երեկոյի զարեն (Wishes for a good evening)

Once upon a time, in the heart of the Armenian Highlands, there was a magical land called Ani. It was a place where the sun dipped into the mountains and painted the sky with hues of pink and gold, where the air was sweet with the scent of apricots and pomegranates, and where the sound of the river Hrazdan sang a soothing lullaby.

In this enchanted land, there lived a little Armenian boy named Aram. Aram had big, bright eyes and a mop of curly black hair that resembled the branches of the majestic apricot trees that grew in the village. He lived with his family in a small village surrounded by the rolling hills and the majestic Mountains of Armenia.

Every night, after a busy day of helping his family with their farmwork, Aram would lie down on his bed, made of soft, plush rugs and comforters, and listen to his grandfather, Hakob, tell stories of their ancestors and the bravery of the ancient Armenian heroes.

One evening, as the stars twinkled in the sky, Hakob began to spin a tale of a magical kingdom hidden deep within the mountains. He told of a beautiful princess named Siranuysh, who had the most striking beauty, with hair as black as the night sky and eyes as blue as the brightest stars. Siranuysh lived in a castle made of shining silver, surrounded by a vast forest teeming with creatures from the ancient times.

As the story unfolded, Aram's eyes grew heavy with dreams, and he felt himself transported to the magical kingdom. He saw Siranuysh, surrounded by her loyal servants, who were busy weaving the most exquisite carpets and embroideries. He heard the rustling of the leaves, the chirping of the birds, and the gentle hum of the bees collecting nectar from the flowers.

The next morning, when the sun rose over the mountains, Aram woke up to the sound of his mother's gentle voice calling him for breakfast. As he got dressed and ran outside to help his family with the farmwork, he felt a strange feeling in his heart – as if the magic of the story had left a small piece of itself within him.

As the days went by, Aram began to notice strange occurrences around the village. The crops grew stronger and taller, the apricot trees bore more fruit, and the river Hrazdan flowed with an abundance of fish. He realized that the story his grandfather had told him had awakened a part of him that was connected to the land and its magic.

And so, every night, Aram would listen to his grandfather's stories, and with each tale, he felt himself growing more connected to the land, to his family, and to the ancient traditions of his people. He knew that he was a part of a long line of brave and strong Armenians who had once lived and thrived in this very land.

As you, my dear child, drift off to sleep tonight, I want you to remember that you too are a part of this magnificent heritage. May the magic of the stories and the land guide you on your path, and may you always carry the heart and soul of Armenia with you.

Շուտ ես քեզ հուզ կան, մանկաս քեզ հաջողության (Sleep tight, my child, may fortune smile upon you)
